enb_long_title: Seventh Conference of the Parties to the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change
sentences: During Article 6 negotiations, the EU, Umbrella Group and G-77/China put forward divergent positions on issues relating to: the criteria for baselines and monitoring; accreditation and verification procedures; Supervisory Committee responsibilities, composition, election of Chair and Vice-Chair, decision-making, and the coverage of costs of participation of members from developing country Parties; eligibility requirements relating to the procedures and mechanisms on compliance; the early start of projects, and their eligibility for emission reduction units (ERUs) as of 2008; and administrative costs. All these issues were forwarded to ministers for consideration, and resolved during negotiations held from 7-10 November.
